> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

This pushes the limitations of the condition editor a bit. The unit editbox would be used to determine what unit to look for the aura on (same as all other buff/debuff conditions). The first editbox would be used for the spell name, and the second editbox would be used for the unit to match with the caster of the aura. There would be no room for the sloder for true/false status.

I'll think about it.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

If caster only support names (don't support UnitId like raid1/mouseover/etc), i think can make it like condition unitisunit.

If support all UnitId, i think can put caster to localtion of OPERATOR, all other like unitisunit.

> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

The information returned by the API about who casted an aura is a unitID, and it wont return ridiculous things like "focustargetpettarget". Only simple things like "target", "focus", "mouseover", "raid7", "boss3", etc.

Edited Aug 14, 2011

I think can put Caster in this place.


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

Hmmm. What would be some of the uses of this condition?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Few days ago, i try to make tmw to track raid1-25 buffs/cooldowns (used more than 75 icons). in fact, i think i need a option to check only show who cast that spells. It's looks like the icon check raid1-25, but have a option, icon only show that spells from caster is XXX if check this option.

e.g:
I tracked 4 spells from deathknight/warrior/druid/paladin for raid1-25, but only show spells when that spells are cast by paladin, this option is more like "Only show mine".

Edited Aug 28, 2011

> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

After putting this off for a long time, I have decided not to implement this. What I will do is provide you with what you need to make this out of a Lua condition.

``` select(8, UnitBuff("player", "Blessing of Might")) == "target" ```

Replace:

  • "player" with the unit you want to check for the buff
  • "Blessing of Might" with the buff you want to check for
  • "target" with the unit you want to check to see if they casted the buff
  • UnitBuff with UnitDebuff if you want to check debuffs.

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
